name: ignorantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is caused by not having enough knowledge, understanding, or information about something : They either ignorantly or conveniently forgot about the events of recent history. You can be cruel carelessly and ignorantly, without realizing what you're doing.
UK informal in a way that is not polite or does not show respect: The proposal was arrogantly and ignorantly rejected by the opposition.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are people that ignorantly think that just by passing laws, these tragic incidents will stop.Ignorantly, I thought he was referring to the Catholic/Protestant divide.These vandals are ignorantly trying to destroy a building that is there for the use of all the community.
